comment: Nigerian Property Intelligence Database - 50+ Cities Across 36 States
milestone: Month 1, Week 1 Complete - Expanded from 8 to 52 locations

Ajah.notes: Fast-developing area. Flood risk reduces property value by 15-20%. Negotiate hard.

Lekki Phase 1.notes: Prime location. High demand. Prices stable but expensive. Good for rental income.

Victoria Island.notes: Premium location. Institutional investors active. Low rental yield but high capital appreciation.

Ikoyi.notes: Old money neighborhood. Ultra-premium. Lowest risk in Lagos. Best for capital preservation.

Surulere.notes: Mature neighborhood. Good rental income. Mixed-use area. Traffic congestion during rush hour.

Maitama.notes: Abuja's premium district. Diplomats and executives. Federal land (no Omo Onile). Stable prices.

Gwarinpa.notes: Largest estate in West Africa. Family-friendly. Good middle-class investment. Federal land.

Ikeja GRA.notes: Government Reservation Area. Corporate executives. Near airport. Stable and secure.

Garki.notes: Central Abuja. Commercial hub. Federal land. High expat population. Good for both residential and commercial.

Sabon Gari.notes: Commercial district in Kano. Northern Nigeria's largest city. High rental demand from traders.

Bodija.notes: University of Ibadan area. Student rentals popular. Good for buy-to-let. SW Nigeria's largest city.

GRA Phase 2.notes: Oil industry hub. High expat demand. Serious flood risk in rainy season. Negotiate 20% discount for flood zones.

Barnawa.notes: Kaduna's GRA. Military presence. Good infrastructure. Northern commercial center after Kano.

GRA.notes: Ancient Benin Kingdom capital. Cultural heritage site. Growing tech hub. Good appreciation potential.

Independence Layout.notes: Coal City capital. SE Nigeria's hub. Good appreciation. Growing tech and business community.

State Housing.notes: Tourist city. Carnival destination. Clean and organized. Good for holiday rentals and Airbnb.

Effurun.notes: Oil industry town. High flood risk. Refinery workers rental market. Buy only on elevated areas.

Aba North.notes: Commercial manufacturing hub. Serious flood issues. High rental yield from traders. Only buy on high ground.

Rayfield.notes: Tin mining heritage. Cool climate. Tourism potential. Security concerns due to ethnic tensions. Best highland property in Nigeria.

Oke Mosan.notes: Gateway to Lagos (1hr drive). Fast appreciation. Lagos workers relocating here. Olumo Rock tourism. Good investment.

Alagbaka.notes: Cocoa capital. GRA area. Government workers market. Clean and peaceful. Undervalued compared to Lagos.

New GRA.notes: Food basket of Nigeria. Benue River floods. Agriculture hub. High risk properties. Only elevated areas recommended.

Bosso Estate.notes: Gateway between North and South. Federal University town. Strategic location on Abuja-Lagos route. Growing demand.

GRA.notes: Emirate city. University of Ilorin market. Middle Belt connector. Peaceful. Good student rental market.

Oke Fia.notes: Cultural heritage site (Osun-Osogbo Grove - UNESCO). Tourism potential. Affordable market. State capital.

New Owerri.notes: SE commercial hub. Good road network. Growing tech scene. Land disputes common. Verify C of O thoroughly.

Use Offot.notes: Oil-rich state capital. Well-planned city. High government investment. Good infrastructure. Strong appreciation potential.

GRA.notes: Yankari Game Reserve tourism. Northern heritage site. Low property prices. Long-term hold for appreciation. Government workers market.

Magami.notes: Highland state capital. Remote location. Tourism potential (Mambilla Plateau). Security concerns. Very affordable entry point.

Phase 2.notes: Confluence of Niger and Benue rivers. Strategic location. MAJOR flood risk. Only buy elevated areas. Abuja proximity (2hrs) drives demand.

New Nyanya.notes: Mining and agriculture hub. Close to Abuja (2hrs). Salt, limestone deposits. Growing demand from Abuja workers seeking affordability.

Jimeta.notes: Northeast commercial center. Security concerns (Boko Haram proximity). Flood risk from Benue River. Low prices reflect high risk. Cautious approach.

Pompomari.notes: Sahel border state. SERIOUS security concerns (insurgency). Extremely risky investment. Only for high-risk appetite. Lowest property prices in Nigeria.

Bajoga.notes: Northeast gateway. Emerging city. Government investment increasing. Security improving. Speculative long-term hold.

Central Market Area.notes: Historical Islamic caliphate. Sultan's seat. Cultural heritage. Trade hub to Niger Republic. Religious tourism potential.

GRA.notes: Northern trade center. Emirate city. Border to Niger. Security concerns (banditry). President Buhari's home state. Government presence.

Takur.notes: Agricultural state capital. Farming economy. Low commercial activity. Very affordable. Long-term speculative investment only.

Birnin Kebbi GRA.notes: Rice production hub. Niger River basin. Flood risk moderate. Agricultural economy. Limited commercial activity. Very affordable entry.

Epe.notes: Eastern Lagos expansion corridor. Dangote Refinery nearby (major catalyst). High flood risk but massive appreciation potential. Buy on elevated plots only.

Badagry.notes: Atlantic coast heritage site (slave trade history). Tourism potential. Benin border gateway. High flood risk. Deep Blue Line coming. Speculative hot zone.

Sango Ota.notes: Industrial belt. Covenant University nearby. Lagos commuters hub (30mins to Ikeja). Factory workers' market. Strong rental demand.

Sagamu.notes: Manufacturing hub (cement, plastics, textiles). Gateway between Lagos and Ibadan. Industrial rental market. Good infrastructure.

Ogbomoso.notes: LAUTECH University town. Student rentals strong. Third largest city in Oyo. Agricultural trade center. Good buy-to-let opportunities.

Ado-Ekiti.notes: Hilly terrain state capital. Low flood risk. EKSU University market. Cool climate. Peaceful. Government workers and academia. Hidden gem.

GRA.notes: Niger Bridge gateway (Onitsha connection). Second Niger Bridge catalyst. High flood risk (Niger River). Elevated areas premium. Growing fast.

World Bank.notes: SE state capital. Clean and organized. Government workers market. Michael Okpara University nearby. Peaceful. Better than Aba for residential.

Kpirikpiri.notes: Rice production state. Salt mining potential. EBSU University town. Affordable. Government infrastructure push. Emerging investment destination.

Ekeki.notes: Niger Delta oil hub. EXTREME flood risk (creek city). Oil workers market. High prices despite flood risk. Buy ONLY if oil sector tenant guaranteed. Very risky.

Fegge.notes: West Africa's LARGEST market. Massive commercial activity. High flood risk (Niger River). Excellent rental yield from traders. Commercial property goldmine despite risks.

Awka GRA.notes: Anambra state capital. UNIZIK University town. Government seat. Cleaner than Onitsha. Good appreciation. SE investment hotspot.

Gwange.notes: Northeast capital. EXTREME security risk (Boko Haram epicenter). Aid workers only market. Lowest appreciation in Nigeria. DO NOT INVEST unless humanitarian mission. Extreme caution.

Owerri Municipal.notes: Entertainment capital of the East. Vibrant nightlife. FUTO nearby. Young professionals market. Hotels/Airbnb potential. Good rental demand. Active property market.
